description.narrative: By end 2017, at least 90% of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ARVs for PMTCT and the proportion of infected children, including adolescents living with HIV receiving anti retroviral treatment has increased by 15 points in the geographical areas contributing more than half of the unmet needs in PMTCT and pediatric AIDS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2017, at least 90% of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ARVs for PMTCT and the proportion of infected children, including adolescents living with HIV receiving anti retroviral treatment has increased by 15 points in the geographical areas contributing more than half of the unmet needs in PMTCT and pediatric AIDS

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the PNPCSP for the scaling up of PMTCT and pediatric care (PECP) through the intensification of integration of new sites offering ANC/PMTCT and Pediatric HIV care services. Consequently, the number of health centers/posts offering PMTCT services has increased from 313 in 2016 to 641 in 2017. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:13/12/2017

title.narrative: % of children living with HIV under antiretroviral treatment
